metadata.synopsis: In this scene, Gale is conjuring an image of Mystra over the palm of his hand, staring at the goddess he’s love with, but who abandoned him. When the player approaches, he dispels the image and he feels embarrassed to have been caught doing what he was doing. The conversation turns to his passion for magic however, and he invites the player to try to cast a spell with him together. The player can do so by passing through various stages of spell casting, and when successful, this can lead to a first player-initiated romantic moment with Gale.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.

139.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale holds out his arm. Above the palm of his hand is conjured in gold-coloured magic the image of a woman, the goddess Mystra. He's looking at the figure intensely.

110.speaker: Player
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Startled, he dispells it.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: Oh! My, you startled me. I... I was miles away.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Startled, he dispells it.NodeContext: Gale is looking at a miniature magical projection of Mystra he's created in his hand in his hand. Startled, he dispells it.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: Of course, of course. I was just... practising an incantation.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: There's more to it than that. The figure I saw: she means something to you.
115.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

145.speaker: Gale
145.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

58.speaker: Gale
58.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

185.speaker: Gale
185.text: I can't quite describe it, the need I sometimes feel to see her - to draw the filaments of fantasy into existence.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: No sculpture or painting could ever do her justice, only the fabric that she herself is and embodies:

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: Mystra is all magic. And as far as I'm concerned, she is all creation.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: I didn't realise the depth of your devotion.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Sounding more of a poet than a wizard there, Gale.

216.speaker: Gale
216.text: It's a kind of love after all.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I quite agree. There's no greater deity than Mystra.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I wouldn't go quite that far myself.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: No, but you do understand, don't you?

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Magic is... my life. I've been in touch with the Weave for as long as I can remember. There's nothing like it.

165.speaker: Gale
165.text: It's like music, poetry, physical beauty all rolled into one and given expression through the senses.

178.speaker: Gale
178.text: Would you like to experience this?
178.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

194.speaker: Player
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Gale walks around behind the player (as though teaching them to fly a kite) and makes a delicate gesture with both hands.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Mystra normally answers me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

114.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.

203.text: *A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*
203.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player imitates the gesture. There’s a first visual effect. Some sparks of magic start to appear around the player and Gale.

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *A familiar feeling - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Imitate the gesture with a flourish.
25.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

198.speaker: Gale
198.text: *You feel something strange - like a kind word and a kind touch at the same time. It's warm and comfortable.*
198.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: Excellent. Now repeat after me: Ah-Thran Mystra-Ryl Kantrach-Ao.
92.context: NodeContext: The line can be read just like the words appear, but with some mystical gravitas in the pronunciation. I picture this spoken the way Morgana speaks the Charm of Making in the following clip from Excalibur: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttq_4FwvLJo&gl=BE (First result when searching for “excalibur charm of making” on youtube.)

144.speaker: Player
144.text: An easy incantation. Simply repeat after Gale.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.

170.text: *Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*
170.context: CinematicNodeContext: The visual effect intensifies. There’s the start of a glow, of a rush of beautiful magic.

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Ah, yes: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*

166.speaker: Player
166.text: You sense power in these words. Speak them deliberately.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

132.text: *Suddenly: the scent of rosewater and a sense of wellbeing. A sliver of Weave that tastes sweet on the tongue.*
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

31.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

187.speaker: Gale
187.text: Very good. Now I want you to picture in your mind the concept of harmony. As true as you can.
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Recede into the calm centre of your mind, just like you were taught at the academy.
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Sink deep into your magic. It is who you are. It is home.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Harmony comes easily to you. Allow it to wash over your mind and magic.
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

44.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Gale are now fully enveloped in a magic glow - a protective field of beautiful magic. Unconsciously player steps back closer to Gale.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the unmistakable presence of Mystra, the Lady of Mysteries.*

107.text: *There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

202.speaker: Narrator
202.text: *There's something like the anticipation of a kiss, then the pleasure of being cloaked in peace.*

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of Mystra's hand.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *You are safe. You are nestled in the cup of her hand.*

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: Look at that. We're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

135.speaker: Gale
135.text: You did it. You're channelling the Weave. How does it feel?

183.speaker: Player
183.text: The same as it always does.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: You're hard to please, aren't you?

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The Weave connects you. The moment feels intimate.*
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Hold on to the moment. It's a good night for intimacy.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *You realise the Weave is making you one. You have but to imagine your desire, and Gale will know it.*
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The magic glow is at its peak. It makes the player and Gale look like the only people in the world, safe in their own miniature dimension.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *You perceive quick-fire gusts of embarrassment, trepidation, and finally... elation.*

210.speaker: Gale
210.text: Sorry, I wasn't expecting... But it is a pleasant image to be sure!

155.speaker: Gale
155.text: Most pleasant, in fact. Most welcome.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *The Weave evaporates, and as it does so, you realise the night feels suddenly cold and lonesome.*
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: All that beautiful magic slips away, and as it does, the player and Gale find themselves in the here and now again.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: There it goes. How easily things slip away from us, no matter how hard they were in the obtaining.
82.context: NodeContext: The weave disappears – he says this with a passionate melancholy.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: Good night. I enjoyed sharing a moment of magic with you.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Picture kicking him in the gut.
34.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

32.speaker: Gale
32.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured hitting him in the stomach, which he does not quite appreciate.

217.speaker: Gale
217.text: There it goes. I suppose a blow to the stomach upsets the Weave as much as it would me.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: I'm going to bed. Perhaps this was all a mistake.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Picture his severed head on a spike.
156.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.

191.speaker: Gale
191.text: Good gods, what on earth makes you picture that?
191.context: NodeContext: Gale and the player are bonded by the Weave, allowing the player to conjure an image in Gale’s head that projects your feelings towards him. In this node, the player pictured Gale’s head on a spike. He is surprised, hurt, angry and disgusted all at once.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Picture nothing. This is a bad idea.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: This feels too intimate. It's time to let slip the Weave.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel Mystra's presence.

195.speaker: Gale
195.text: Quite so. The Weave is a sensitive conduit.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: It's different, but I can definitely feel a familiar kind of presence.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It feels like a good time to call it a night.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Picture the perfect darkness - to be in the womb of Shar.

65.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*

173.speaker: Narrator
173.text: *You see - or is it sense? - the presence of a woman, the woman who hovered over Gale's palm.*

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Recall a memory of early youth, a happy family moment.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Picture a place of utter peace, away from all harm and the mayhem of civilisation.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Think of the here and now: this unexpected moment of learning.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Try to hum a familiar tune.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: That's too abstract for my tastes. Let's just forget about it, shall we?

130.speaker: Gale
130.text: I think it's a mistake to give up on the brink of success, but I cannot force your hand.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Repeat the words, bold and proud.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Repeat the words, slowly, but carefully.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Belt the words with a little flourish on 'Ao'.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Actually, I dislike tongue twisters. Let's just call it a night.

43.text: Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: Not quite. But this is the easy part. Shall we try again?

104.speaker: Player
104.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

126.speaker: Gale
126.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
126.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

7.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
7.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

105.speaker: Gale
105.text: No, I'm sorry, but it looks like magic's not on the cards tonight. Perhaps I'm not quite the teacher I fancy myself to be.
105.context: NodeContext: The player failed to perform the necessary steps involved in spell casting. You really wanted the player to succeed, but alas.

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. As I'm sure you're aware.

122.speaker: Gale
122.text: In any case, don't blame yourself. Mystra can be a fickle mistress. Coy to a tee.

201.speaker: Player
201.text: No, thanks. Not my cup of tea, clearly.

215.speaker: Gale
215.text: I think it's a mistake to give up so easily, but I cannot force your hand.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: Imitate the gesture quickly and decisively.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Imitate the gesture slowly and as precisely as you can.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Actually, never mind. Magic is just not for me.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: I think it's a mistake to hold that conviction, but I cannot force your hand.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Magic normally comes to me through prayer, but I don't mind trying.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: No, I have no interest in such magic.

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: Disinterest is such a disheartening condition.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: Always a pity when opportunities slip us by.

123.speaker: Gale
123.text: Is it the same for you?
123.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

213.speaker: Player
213.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: Perhaps we can share the experience by reaching into the Weave together.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: It's getting late. Perhaps another time.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: It's different for me. Not quite so intense.
196.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

153.speaker: Player
153.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: You wouldn't say that if you felt what I feel.

207.speaker: Gale
207.text: Perhaps I can show you what I mean by reaching into the Weave together.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Magic is music, poetry, and beauty. Though I suspect you and I perform it differently.
97.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Magic is like music. But while you need it written down, I can play by ear.
8.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

162.speaker: Gale
162.text: Fair enough - though in the end we're still playing the same composition.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: My magic is both ancient and raw. Sometimes even volatile.
179.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: Yes - as raw and ancient as the veins of Bahamut.

163.speaker: Gale
163.text: Still, it is magic in its purest, most essential rapture that I'm trying to impart.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: It's less 'music and poetry', and more 'I hope I don't blow up'.
71.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

150.speaker: Gale
150.text: Believe it or not, I can relate.
150.context: NodeContext: said with a wry grin

0.speaker: Player
0.text: That's just a lot of delusion speaking.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: How narrow-minded. Magic goes far, far beyond Mystra.

182.speaker: Gale
182.text: Pish posh. One might as well deny one's mother's womb as the cradle of life.

188.text: You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.

205.speaker: Gale
205.text: You read too much into it. I was merely indulging in my passion.

80.speaker: Player
80.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

143.speaker: Gale
143.text: I do - because it's through practice that I seek to perfect. To augment.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I'll leave you to it then. Good night.
148.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

24.speaker: Gale
24.context: NodeContext: Distracted. Still miles away in his head.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: The figure you conjured: who is she? Someone you miss?

169.speaker: Gale
169.text: No, no. She's no one, really. I was just... practising an incantation.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You don't have that look on your face when you're looking at 'no one'.
47.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

53.text: What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.
53.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

119.speaker: Gale
119.text: What can I say? She's... She's Mystra.
119.context: NodeContext: He says the name with reverence. She’s his muse, his love, his passion.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Care to tell me why you were conjuring an image of Mystra?
124.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I know that look. You were praying to your goddess, weren't you?
109.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: Not praying. Not quite. I was just... practising an incantation.
96.context: NodeContext: He was recalling Mystra as a lover, but doesn't say that out loud.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: No, there's more to it than that. I know devotion when I see it.

147.speaker: Gale
147.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

41.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

137.speaker: Gale
137.text: I'm no cleric, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: I'm no paladin, like you are. It's different for a wizard.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Just go to sleep, why don't you. We have a long day ahead of us.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: That's Mystra - the Mother of All Magic herself.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: Cut that out. The light could attract enemies.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: That's the deity you wizards adore - Mystra, right?
